recipes.title: Butter Chicken
recipes.method: 1. If you are looking for a dairy free substitute that is equally rich and creamy, try substituting coconut milk for the heavy cream. 2. Do not toss out the butter: it makes the sauce nice and glossy, and gives the chicken a gorgeous flavor. 3. You can make butter chicken without marinating the chicken first (simply brown the chicken in the pan with the spices and onions), but time in a marinade will get you closer to the succulent meat of the authentic butter chicken recipe. 4. No tandoor oven or any other special equipment is required: you can absolutely cook butter chicken using the regular pots and pans you have on hand.

recipes.title: Fish Curry
recipes.method: 1. Preheat slow cooker to sauté and add 2 tbsp of coconut oil. 2. Add 8-10 curry leaves, and allow to simmer for 30 seconds until aromatic. 3. Add 1 cup finely chopped onion, 1 tbsp minced garlic cloves, 1 tbsp minced ginger, and ½-1 whole sliced green chili, depending on heat preference. 4. Cook until onions are translucent. 5. Add 1 cup chopped tomato, stirring until liquid is released and they have begun to break down.

recipes.title: Meat Masala
recipes.method: 1. To make lamb vindaloo, swap the chicken for four lamb shanks. 2. Brown the shanks as directed in the pot. 3. Increase cooking time to 3 hours on low heat. 4. When lamb is tender and falling apart in the sauce.

recipes.title: Paneer Curry
recipes.method: 1. First, soak 12 to 15 cashews in hot water for 20 to 30 minutes. 2.Then add turmeric powder, red chili powder, coriander powder and garam masala powder. 3.On a low to medium heat, simmer the cottage cheese curry till it thickens a bit and you see oil specks on top. Then add paneer cubes.
